name: Off-channel Habitat Availability
functionStatement: Channel and floodplain structure supply depth, velocity, substrate diversity, and vegetation to support native organisms through all life stages.
descriptionMarkdown: Backwater areas are accessible as nursery/refuge if historically present, unless naturally confined.
howToMeasureMarkdown: Map connected backwaters and side channels and verify likely connection thresholds.

inputs.label: Off-channel Habitat Availability
inputs.helpMarkdown: High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon; Historical evidence

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: Well connected off-channel areas provide refuge or spawning habitat. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Some partial connection. / Rare or only episodic off-channel use. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: No side or backwaters remain despite suitable valley setting. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.29)

sourceMetadata.metricDataSource: High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon; Historical evidence

bin1.desc: No side or backwaters remain despite suitable valley setting.

bin2.desc: Some partial connection. / Rare or only episodic off-channel use.

bin3.name: Good
